data.name: List API endpoints
data.description: List information about all API endpoints, or get info on single endpoint (specify name or url).

responses.description: A list of endpoint objects
url parameter did not match any endpoints
name parameter did not match any endpoints

parameterDescriptions.name: The name of the endpoint (see the full endpoint listing for names)
parameterDescriptions.url: The url of the endpoint to describe (see the full endpoint listing for names)

data.name: Describe properties
data.description: Describe an objects's properties, optionally translated.

responses.description:
Returns a localized description of and object's enumerable properties. If the
                                          property parameter was provided, only this property is described. The returned
                                          object has the property name(s) as key(s) and an object of possibles values as
                                          keys, and localized descriptions as values.
Missing required parameter object
No description found for this object

parameterDescriptions.object:
The object to describe. Possible values:

* `User`
* `Address`
* `Email`
* `Phone`
* `Product`
* `BundleItem`
* `Subscription`
* `Content`
* `Discount`
* `Order`
* `OrderItem`
* `Identifier`
* `Transaction`
* `Campaign`
* `Utilities`
* `Voucher`
parameterDescriptions.property: The property to describe. To get a list of possible values, get the full description of an object.

data.name: Platform status
data.description: Get status information from the platform

responses.description: Returns the current status of the API.
Returns the current status of the API.

data.name: Platform version
data.description: Find out what version you are using

responses.description: Returns a description of the currently deployed SPiD version

data.name: Platform terms
data.description: Returns the current user terms for the client and SPiD

responses.description: The current terms, and whether they are accepted by the user, if a user token is provided.

parameterDescriptions.client_id: Retrieve the terms for this client. If not provided, the SPiD terms are returned.
parameterDescriptions.oauth_token: OAuth token for a user whose accepted flag should be changed
parameterDescriptions.not_accepted: Control which terms are controlled on behalf of the user. When 1, check if the user has accepted the SPiD terms. When 0, check that the user has accepted the client terms.

responses.description: Request must contain URL encoded content
Product not found

data.description: Exchanges an authorization code

responses.description: OAuth exchange object
Required client ID missing
Missing redirect URI, which is required when the type is set to "session"
Request must contain a valid exchange type
Provided client ID does not belong to the current merchant

parameterDescriptions.clientId: The ID of a client belonging to the same merchant as the calling client.
parameterDescriptions.type: The type of exchange. `code` is the only supported type.
parameterDescriptions.redirectUri: The redirect URI must be a registered redirectUri, otherwise the request will be rejected.

data.name: Create, get or delete data objects by type, ID and key
data.description: Data storage endpoint. NB! POST does not work with explorer.

responses.description: Retrieves a previously stored data object. The data object structure is defined by the client who stored it.
The provided type is not valid
The provided ID does not exist for the provided type
No object found for this key
The newly created data object
Object could not be stored
Could not find any valid key
Could not find key/value pair in posted data

parameterDescriptions.type: The base API type to associate data with. One of `user`, `product`, `order`, `discount` or `client`.
parameterDescriptions.id: The ID of the object to associate data with.
parameterDescriptions.key: The unique key of the data object.

data.name: Get or create data objects by type, sub type, ID and key
data.description: Data storage sub endpoint. NB POST does not work with explorer

responses.description: Retrieves a previously stored data object. The data object structure is defined by the client who stored it.
The provided type is not valid
The provided ID does not exist for the provided type
No object found for this key
The newly created data object.
Object could not be stored
Could not find any valid key
Could not find key/value pair in posted data

parameterDescriptions.type: The base API type to associate data with. One of `user`, `product`, `order`, `discount` or `client`.
parameterDescriptions.id: The ID of the object to associate data with.
parameterDescriptions.subtype: When `type` is user, the `subtype` may be one of `product`, `order` or `subscription`, and attaches a data object to an object owned by the user.
parameterDescriptions.subid: ID of the user owned sub-type
parameterDescriptions.key: The unique key of the data object.

data.name: Get, update, and delete data objects by user
data.description: User data storage.

responses.description: Retrieves the data object stored under this key for this user. The format of the data object is entirely dictated by the client and may be of any type.
Missing id and/or key parameters
Token is not authorized to access this user
No data object found for this key
The newly created data object.
One or more required parameters are missing
Missing id and/or key parameters
Could not find any data object for the provided key
Token is not authorized to access this user
Returns an object indicating whether or not deleting was successful.
Missing id and/or key parameters
Token is not authorized to access this user

parameterDescriptions.id: ID of the user to associate data with
parameterDescriptions.key: The data object key. Max length is 255 bytes.
parameterDescriptions.value: Data of any kind. Max length is 65535 bytes.

data.name: Create user
data.description: Create a new user

responses.description: Returns the newly created user object.

parameterDescriptions.name: Full name
parameterDescriptions.addresses: A JSON string. A map of addresses, with the address type as keys and the address objects/maps as values. See [the address type](/types/address) for appropriate types
parameterDescriptions.gender: Gender. Legal values and a localized description can be fetched from [/api/2/describe/User?property=gender](/endpoints/GET/describe/{object}).
parameterDescriptions.url: An external URL related to the user
parameterDescriptions.utcOffset: The user's timezone, given as UTC offset (number of hours), e.g. "+02:00" etc
parameterDescriptions.redirectUri: When the user is created, they will receive an email to confirm. After completing registration, they will be redirected to this URL if specified. If not specified, the user is redirected to the client default redirectUri.

data.name: Signup
data.description: Create a new user (no update)

responses.description: Returns the new user

parameterDescriptions.email: Email of the user. Must be unique across all of SPiD
parameterDescriptions.redirectUri: Where to redirect the user after completing signup

data.description: Get a user data object or post changes to one.

responses.description: Returns the user object.
Requested user was not found
Client is not authorixed to access this user
Token is not authorized to access this user
User was not found
Client or merchant is not authorized to access this user
Returns the updated user object.
Requested user was not found
Client is not authorixed to access this user
Token is not authorized to access this user
User was not found
Client or merchant is not authorized to access this user

parameterDescriptions.userId: The user's `userId` (not to be mistaken with the deprecated `id`).
parameterDescriptions.name: New full name
parameterDescriptions.addresses: A JSON string. A map of addresses, with the address type as keys and the address objects/maps as values. See [the address type](/types/address) for appropriate types
parameterDescriptions.gender: New gender. Legal values and a localized description can be fetched from [/api/2/describe/User?property=gender](/endpoints/GET/describe/{object}).
parameterDescriptions.url: New external URL related to the user
parameterDescriptions.utcOffset: New timezone, given as UTC offset (number of hours), e.g. "+02:00"
parameterDescriptions.redirectUri: The change may trigger a confirmation email to the user. After completing the change, they will be redirected to this URL if specified. If not specified, the user is redirected to the client default redirectUri.

data.name: Direct payment charge
data.description: Request a direct payment charge on a user.

responses.description: Returns the order object
API error code 2000, The user cancelled the request.
API error code 1800, The request is invalid and can not be completed.
API error code 1810, The request parameters are invalid.
API error code 1100, The account or card is blocked in the provider.
API error code 1200, The user is blacklisted.
API error code 1300, The method (card) is not eligible for this purchase.
API error code 1400, The method (card) is blacklisted.
API error code 2100, The payment request was flagged by automatic fraud detection.
API error code 1700, The payment request does not conform to the prerequisites (i.e. wrong order status)
API error code 110, Payment method missing. The method (card) is not eligible for payment because it is missing, i.e., the user has not entered a payment method into their SPiD account.
API error code 120, Payment method expired. The method (card) is not eligible for payment because it is expired.
API error code 210, Direct payment disabled. Direct payment is disabled for the client or the SPiD service as a whole.
API error code 1900, The payment request failed due to insufficient funds on account.
API error code 2200, The payment request was flagged by automatic API abuse detection.
API error code 310, Transaction amount limit exceeded.
API error code 320, Transaction count limit exceeded.
API error code 330, Time since last transaction is too short.
API error code 340, Too many failures.
API error code 1500, SPiD/Payment provider is currently experiencing problems.
API error code 1600, Payment provider is unavailable to SPiD.
API error code 9900, The error could not be categorized.

parameterDescriptions.userId: The user's `userId` (not to be mistaken with the deprecated `id`).
parameterDescriptions.tag: To be used for tracking. Will be returned in all order endpoints

data.description: Retrieve account balance for a user.

data.description: List users

responses.description: Returns all users matched by the query.
No users found

parameterDescriptions.fields: A [list of fields](/endpoints/#parameters) to select, makes for a slimmer response.
parameterDescriptions.userId: Exact match.
parameterDescriptions.email: Exact match for the primary email.
parameterDescriptions.emails: Exact match for either the primary or one of the secondary emails.
parameterDescriptions.displayName: Sub-string match from the beginning of the displayName
parameterDescriptions.givenName: Sub-string match from the beginning of the given name
parameterDescriptions.familyName: Sub-string match from the beginning of the family name
parameterDescriptions.fullName: Sub-string match from the beginning of the given name and family name combined
parameterDescriptions.preferredUsername: Sub-string match from the beginning of the preferred user name
parameterDescriptions.phoneNumber: Sub-string match from the beginning of the primary phone number
parameterDescriptions.phoneNumbers: Sub-string match from the beginning of any phone number
parameterDescriptions.orderId: Search by orderId, if provideded will return the user that owns the order.

data.name: Trigger
data.description: Trigger a `newpassword` or `emailverification` for user

responses.description: Returns an indication of whether or not the trigger was sent successfully.

parameterDescriptions.userId: The user's `userId` (not to be mistaken with the deprecated `id`).
parameterDescriptions.trigger:
What kind of email trigger to send. Currently only two options:

* `emailverification` - Sends an email to the user, asking them to verify their email address.
* `newpassword` - Sends an email to the user with a link to create a new password. The password reset link is valid for 24 hours.

data.description: Search for products (for client)

responses.description: Returns a list of products.
No products found

parameterDescriptions.name: Search for exact matches of this name
parameterDescriptions.code: Search for exact matches of this code
parameterDescriptions.price: Search for exact matches of this price
parameterDescriptions.parentProductId: List all products with this parent product

data.name: Create product
data.description: Create a new product template

responses.description: Returns the newly created product
Missing one or more required parameters
Failed to create or update product

parameterDescriptions.code: Client-defined product code. More easily recognizable than the numeric ID.
parameterDescriptions.name: The product name
parameterDescriptions.bundle: If the product is of type bundle, this field decides what bundle type. Bundle type 0: Not a bundle, 1: Dynamic bundle, 2: One-off bundle
parameterDescriptions.hideItems: If the product is a bundle, this field decides if the bundle items should be hidden (`"1"`) in communications.
parameterDescriptions.parentProductId: ID of the parent product, if any
parameterDescriptions.quantityLimit: If there is a limited supply for this product
parameterDescriptions.saleStart: Provide if there is a sale of some sort
parameterDescriptions.saleStop: Provide if there is a sale of some sort
parameterDescriptions.availableStart: The time from when the product is available for sale ([date time](/types/datetime))
parameterDescriptions.availableStop: The time when the product is no longer available for sale ([date time](/types/datetime))
parameterDescriptions.allowMultiSales: "1" if a user is allowed to purchase this product multiple times, "0" otherwise
parameterDescriptions.subscriptionPeriod: The duration of a subscription period, as a timestamp in seconds
parameterDescriptions.subscriptionRenewPrice: Price of subscription renewals, in cents
parameterDescriptions.subscriptionAutoRenew: "1" if the subscription should automatically renew, "0" otherwise
parameterDescriptions.subscriptionAutoRenewLockPeriod: The duration of the initial period where auto renewal cannot be changed
parameterDescriptions.subscriptionAutoRenewDisabled: "1" if automatic renewals should not be available, "0" if they should
parameterDescriptions.subscriptionGracePeriod: The duration after a failed charge attempt the subscription stays active
parameterDescriptions.subscriptionEmailReceiptLimit: If set to anything not null, will prevent emails from beeing sent on purchase/renewal of this subscription
parameterDescriptions.subscriptionFinalEndDate: A date from when this product is no longer for sale
parameterDescriptions.subscriptionSurveyUrl: URL to a survey for when people terminate a subscription for this product.

parameterDescriptions.title: The voucher group's title
parameterDescriptions.campaignId: ID of the campaign vouchers will be used with
parameterDescriptions.productId: If creating a giveaway voucher group, this is the ID of the product vouchers will grant access to
parameterDescriptions.description: A textual description of the vouchers
parameterDescriptions.unique: If 1, each user receives a unique voucher code that can only redeemed once. If 0, a shared voucher will be issued, and the `limit` can be used to control the number of times it can be redeemed.
parameterDescriptions.limit: The maximum number of times the voucher can be redeemed, if it is a shared voucher

parameterDescriptions.campaignId: The ID of the campaign to update
parameterDescriptions.title: New campaign title
parameterDescriptions.startDate: New date/time when the campaign becomes available
parameterDescriptions.stopDate: New date/time when the campaign ceases to be available
parameterDescriptions.additionalReceiptInfo: New text to include in purchase receipts
parameterDescriptions.requireAddress: 1 or 0. If 1, access to the campaign requires users to have a delivery address in their SPiD profile
parameterDescriptions.requireVoucher: 1 or 0. If 1, access to the campaign requires users to have a valid and available voucher
parameterDescriptions.limit: New maximum number of purchases allowed for this campaign
parameterDescriptions.products: New list of products in this campaign

responses.description: Returns the newly created campaign object

parameterDescriptions.metaData: Additional client meta-data, not used by SPiD
parameterDescriptions.startDate: Date/time when the campaign becomes available
parameterDescriptions.stopDate: Date/time when the campaign ceases to be available
parameterDescriptions.additionalReceiptInfo: Text to include in purchase receipts
parameterDescriptions.requireAddress: 1 or 0. If 1, access to the campaign requires users to have a delivery address in their SPiD profile
parameterDescriptions.requireVoucher: 1 or 0. If 1, access to the campaign requires users to have a valid and available voucher
parameterDescriptions.limit: The maximum number of purchases allowed for this campaign
parameterDescriptions.products: A list of products in this campaign

data.name: List campaigns
data.description: List all campaigns for client

responses.description: Returns a list of campaigns
No campaign mathed search criteria

parameterDescriptions.campaignId: Find the campaign with this ID
parameterDescriptions.title: Find campaigns with title `LIKE` this

responses.description: No identifier found for this ID

responses.description: Payment not found

responses.description: Returns agreements with SPiD/Payex

parameterDescriptions.userId: `userId` of the user to list agreements for

data.name: Logins per user

responses.description: Returns a list of login attempt objects

parameterDescriptions.userId: The user's `userId` (not to be mistaken with the deprecated `id`).
parameterDescriptions.ip: Filter results by this IP address

data.name: Search subscriptions
data.description: Search for subscriptions

responses.description: A list of Subscription objects.

parameterDescriptions.userId: Limit results by the user's `userId` (not to be mistaken with the deprecated `id`).
parameterDescriptions.status: Limit results to subscriptions with this status.

data.name: Search digital content
data.description: Search for purchased digital content

responses.description: A list of DigitalContent objects.

parameterDescriptions.userId: Limit results to digital content purchased by this user.
parameterDescriptions.status: Limit results to digital content with this status.
parameterDescriptions.productId: Limit results to digital content for this product.
parameterDescriptions.parentProductId: Limit results to digital content for this product and its child products.
parameterDescriptions.orderId: Limit results to digital content in this order.

data.name: Search KPI
data.description: Search for Key Performance Indicators

responses.description: A list of KeyPerformanceIndicator objects
No KPI by this name

parameterDescriptions.name: The name of one or more KPIs to query for, comma-separated. See the list of available KPIs above.

data.name: Create PayLink
data.description: Create a PayLink object

responses.description: Returns the newly created paylink object
Missing one or more required parameters
Paylink items is not a list of items
Validation error(s)
Paylink not found

parameterDescriptions.title: The PayLink title. Displayed to the user on the payment page, and shown on the New Credit Card page at Payex.
parameterDescriptions.items: The items to be sold. A list of PayLink Item objects.
parameterDescriptions.clientReference: Your reference. Useful for tracking and processing the Order generated by this PayLink.
parameterDescriptions.purchaseFlow: Defaults to `DIRECT`, which will process the payment straight away. Can also be `AUTHORIZE`, where the payment is on hold and must later be captured.
parameterDescriptions.paymentOptions: The allowed payment methods for this PayLink. An integer bitmask: Credit (1), Credit cards (2), SMS (4), Invoice (8). Defaults to 2.
parameterDescriptions.expires: The date when the PayLink expires. A unix timestamp. Defaults to 24 hours from creation.
parameterDescriptions.redirectUri: Redirect the user to this URL after payment is complete.
parameterDescriptions.cancelUri: Redirect the user to this URL if login or payment is cancelled.
parameterDescriptions.sellerUserId: If set, this user is designated as the seller and will receive the payment.
parameterDescriptions.buyerUserId: If set, only this user has access to the PayLink.

data.name: Get or delete a paylink
data.description: Get or delete a Paylink object

responses.description: The paylink object
Paylink not found
A paylink object, with its status changed to -1 (deleted)
Paylink not found

parameterDescriptions.paylinkId: ID of the paylink to retrieve.

data.name: Search logins
data.description: Query login attemps for a client.

responses.description: A list of login attempt objects.

parameterDescriptions.ip: Filter login attempts by this IP address
parameterDescriptions.status: Filter login attempts by successful (`true`) or failed (`false`) logins
parameterDescriptions.filters: Set to `merchant` to show only login attempts for the current merchant.

data.name: Logout
data.description: Invalidate the user's SPiD session.

responses.description: The response simply says "OK" when the user is logged out.

data.name: Not found error - 404
data.description: Response when requesting an endpoint that does not exist.

responses.description: No such endpoint.
